Description: Rim and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lip-cup; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed below; top of lip glazed; below, on lip, black-figure decoration consisting of hound running to right (rump and hind legs missing; with added red on neck and shoulder); below at junction of lip and handle zone, black band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 88 no. 296 pl. 66)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 388, no. B556, pl. XXVII)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1351) (phase 3)
